duties_responsibilities.duty: Sets the strategy and oversees the operations and administration of the Airlines Clearing House and its various settlement services.
Establishes short and long-term goals, consults with and advises the ACH Board of Directors on financials, actions, emerging issues, opportunities, and daily operations.
Maintains all corporate records, conducts meetings of the ACH Board of Directors, and designs, assesses the value of, and implements products and services to be offered by the ACH.
Exercises general financial oversight for the corporation, drafts, evaluates, negotiates, executes, administers, and maintains contracts with suppliers.
Provides guidance to existing and prospective companies with respect to the application of, and adherence to, the rules and regulations of the various ACH settlement services.

Facilitates consensual resolution of billing disputes, arranges and conducts meetings for the ACH Revenue Accounting Committee, and represents the ACH and its members on the Integrated Settlement System Steering Group.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration or Accounting or equivalent experience. Master's degree preferred.
